title: Opening Ceremony

author: Rudi Studer, Institute of Applied Informatics and Formal Description Methods (AIFB), Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)
Tim Finin, University of Maryland
Steffen Staab, Institute for Web Science and Technologies (WeST), University of Koblenz-Landau
Márta Nagy-Rothengass, DG Communications Networks, Content and Technology (CNECT), European Commission

segmentation: Good morning everyone.
I would like to welcome you to the 7th International Semantic Web Conference here in culture.
My team at AFB&SI worked very hard to set up that event, so hopefully everything will run smoother in the upcoming three days.

In case you have any issue to be addressed, please simply contact one of these persons wearing these blue T shirts with the semantic web semantic card through logo and be sure that that person will be glad to help you.
OK.
I would also like to ask you for a favor we had that passion about wireless access during the sessions for five to 600 people.

Since we have some bandwidth limitation, we kindly ask you to refrain from doing bandwidth intensive tasks like video streaming or using Skype in an very extensive way, or do using it for large downloads.
Pursuit for these kind of activities.
the Internet Cafe we have downstairs available and by applying that kind of rule, we assume that the wireless experience will be improved for all of us.
So thanks for your time and cooperation.
I would also like to announce that the start making the city wiki of cards were go semantics today, so they moved to a semantic Mediawiki based system.
And you will also find English content in that study, so that's one way of experiencing.
What you can achieve by applying semantic technologies?
Let me switch my role here.
I would also like to welcome you as part of the city.
Magic Web Science Association that is the organization running that conference here is for you.

I had the pleasure to be the president of the Semantic Science Association for almost seven years, and I thought it's time to step down in that function, and it's my pleasure to announce that Jim Hendler was elected as the new President for Swsa last evening.
So he will be the responsible person for semantic Web sites Association in the upcoming three years.
And finally, we also always plan two years ahead for running the international Semantic Web Conference.
And last night we made a decision for 2010 and the decision is that it's week 2010 will be hosted in Shanghai.
So make your plans next years for Virginia US and in two years from now Shanghai.
So that was the decision last night.
I wish you all a nice day in Castro and try the conference here.
Enjoy the environment here.
And thank you for coming to class One.
Thank you.
Well, I my name is Tim.
And I'm the general chair this year of Eswick.
I'd like to welcome you to also to Switch 2008, as I'm sure you've seen the website.
Lot of information on the conference and will be updating that several times a day with news item, so please visit that periodically.

Also, this year we are having all of the presentations and most of the tutorials recorded video lectures here speaker, it's important that you fill out one of these forms that will be available just during your session.
That's a release for video lectures to edit and publish the video presentation of your talk on the web.
You also have available a.
A wireless microphone which.

We asked to wear to make sure that there's a good audio recording of your presentation, and finally to provide a copy of your slides if you will to video lectures so that they can synchronize them with the video for publication.
Of course, if you do not wish to be filmed, you don't need to, but we encourage you to do that.
It's a.
It's a great resource.
Also like to point out the error.

We're using crowd Vine to create a sort of dynamic social network community for participants of is with 2008, and if you haven't tried this alidor registered, you know you might something you might do it.
This way.
You can connect with other people at the conference, communicate with them a comment on papers, and so forth.
Of course, we also have a semantic web enabled version of the data on the conference.
All the papers, tutorials, workshops that's available at data.semanticweb.org.
This also allows you to leave comments on the papers and you can access and use the data, perhaps in your research.
In terms of the program, we've already had two days of program with tutorials and workshops.
We've got three more exciting days ago.
Search track and use track sponsor talks, posters and demos, software, web challenge, additional things.
Of course, the program is all available on various forms, so now I'd like to introduce Steven Stop, who is Program Co.
Chair for the research track will make a few comments on that.
Good morning, I had the pleasure to oversee together with me.
She was sitting here the.
Action of papers and it was a very tough selection of 261 papers being submitted to the research track.
Only 40 three were selected and it was a great pleasure reading through the papers and seeing what has been done and we had papers from all over the world.
As you see on this slide, there wasn't actually a large organization.
Actually well you who were involved in picking these papers with 90 vice chairs over 130 PC members also.
Having helped with external reviewers is the large as well as great machinery of people helping to pick the papers.
Um?
From this paper we selected the following sessions.
I there too many papers to name them here, but wanted to pinpoint to a few of these session titles because they indicate to you what is this conference about and use.
We have some of the classical topics like ontology engineering at the top.
Some things become more prominent these days, like the social networks and we have the spirit of the semantic web in our program with web data and web knowledge.
And many other things that we have seen in previous years and have developed and gained and have been made more scalable among the many papers were also the pleasure is select a few to name a few.
Actually, for best paper candidates.
And the best paper nominis that it will announce now the following three.
We will still see who makes it to become the first one among these, the first one will be announced in closing session on Thursday.
The first best paper nominee is the paper by Roman and Kiefer on Semantic Web service choreography, contract ING, and enactment.
It's in the Semantic Web service session, so lookout for the paper.
It's hot.
The second nominee for best paper is by Kato Benz Hotel, about the semantic grounding of tech relatedness in social bookmarking systems.
It's international semantic and social networks.
Again, Lookout watch out for it.
And finally, the third nominee for best paper is by Horridge Presea and Sadler laconic and precise justifications in our.
Watch out.
Now this is just one part.
Of the process, there is still more going on things that require your attention.
There will be a lot of posters and demos.
There will specially also be a selection of best posters that requires your boat so please drop your ballot and help us with selecting the best posters.
And of course we're looking forward to see who becomes the best paper who receives the best paper award in the end?
Thirsty.
At this point, it is my very great pleasure to introduce.
Mark
Nike rocking gas.
She's the head of unit.
For technologies for information management at the European Commission, and as such, she overseas many of the research projects in Europe.
That leader is the results we can observe here during this conference and pleasure to announce her welcome note.
Please.
Thank you very much Steven.
Dear Professor student their team.
Gentlemen, it's a pleasure and an honor for me to be here and to be part of your opening ceremony of the conference.
I was very pleased to hear Tuesday morning that you are expecting 600 researchers and participants business people here for the conference from all sides of the world.
It is a very great pleasure and I would like to congratulate you to these faxes.

As Steven mentioned to you, I come from the European Commission from the factory general information SoC, an medium and our Director general is in charge of the support for the ICT industry research and future development and also to contribute to the response strategy, namely to the realization of knowledge based society.
My unit that I had since 1st of July.
The technologies for information management is contributing strongly to this knowledge based society, especially in cooperation with your Constitution.
I am very pleased to see how many projects founded in the unit or in the Directorate in Luxembourg, here with papers or post us.
In your conference.
Just for you, a few figures the Commission is supporting the Semantic Web, general Web and information technology since the early 80s.
In the 4th and 5th frame for programs, they were big amounts for funding, and in the Sixth Framework Programme semantics.
Creativity in the Internet became too vanki topic and the Commission funded 68 projects in about 300 million funding.
It means more than 400 million budget in total keep topics were cross media content.
Content and taking knowledge.
Knowledge infections out dividual media.
Social media contact.

Coming closer to the actual program to the FP7 program, we are just negotiating the second batch to see the second part of the first word program in it and we will have by end of the year about certain projects for more than 100 million euro running very many projects come from your company's an from your activities.
As next one I am sure you are interested to have a few hints about the future activities.
The future funding.
The next Ver program for 2009, 2010 will be open in November this year in Lyon during the ICT 2008 conference.
I can tell you that.
Topical changes will be in this field of funding.
Maybe you recognize that the name of the unit previously was knowledge and content, and since 1st of July the name of the unit is technologies for information management.
So the key focus of our future activities will be an intelligent information management.
Acting challenges.
With large data sets.
Management of data coming from different sources from sensors vebb, different databases and the real time dimension will become even more important.
We are very pleased to see in this field as well if they are cooperation inside of Europe but also outside of the Europe.
So US or Chinese or Russian or other partners are highly welcomed in our project and funding, especially if there is ugly.
Another value for the project.
About the practical expectation and tips, I just would like to mention you that Europe became 2412 new Member States.
The participation of these new Member States coming from Eastern Europe mass mainly is for the time being very low.
We are aware of it that they are very good research institutes, even successful SMS.
So it would be a nice challenge to integrate.
These researchers and this knowledge deeper in the program, and we also would like to support more participation of small and medium sized companies in the programs.
We are very pleased to see that coming from our project, there are many small companies or startups.
Even here in the room.
About two events to us.
I would like to invite you just a few words.
I just mentioned the Lyon conference.
It will be the largest ICT event of the last two years.
We expect at least 3000 researchers and ICT specialists to network to exchange and to work on the future work program and.
As support for better networking and bitter proposal preparation, we will organize in Budapest most likely on the 22nd of January next year and a proposals the.
In order to bring the different potential partners together and to give you inside information from the Commission as well.
Last but not least, I just would like to remind you that the Commission is working closely together with experts from all scientific fields.
So from your field as well and we are asking an very appreciating knew experts as well.
And all the experts.
So if you are interested to be an expert for reviews or evaluations.
Other research program don't please don't hesitate to contact us and at the same time to register yourself in the FB 7 database.
It will allow you to be contacted and to be involved in this procedure.
I wish you a very successful conference.
Good discussions, networking activities and see you in one of the other sessions.
If you have any questions, I will be here until tomorrow evening.
You are welcome to contact me and I will answer your question face to face.
Thank you very much.
